channel.title: Power supply - what is too strong and what is just right? mA / V / W
channel.description:
Hey community,
I am going to build my first synth and since I don't want to fry my board, I need some help regarding the power supply. My synth is going to be just the board with 10-12 potentiometers plus a contact microphone attached to the input.
My question now is: Which one of these power adaptors is enough / which one is to strong and would fry the board / which mA amount is perfect?
**Nr. 1:** >>> Output voltage: 3.0/4.5/5.0/6.0/7.5/9.0/12 V DC /// Output: 3.6 W /// Current300
https://www.reichelt.de/eco-friendly-plug-in-power-supply-max-300-ma-usb-mw-3a03gs-p108305.html?trstct=pol_0&&r=1
**Nr. 2:** >>> output voltage: 9 V DC /// output current: max. 0.66 A /// power: 6 W
https://www.reichelt.de/single-output-power-supply-9-v-0-66-a-gs06e-2p1j-p161591.html?GROUPID=4978&START=0&OFFSET=16&SID=94W2l1CKwQATQAABOcJzg809dbf59ddc305a440540bef77af57e1&LANGUAGE=EN&&r=1
Please Help me! :smiley: Greets Marvin

item.title: Power supply - what is too strong and what is just right? mA / V / W
item.dc:creator: @Captain_Burek Daniel Büring
item.description:
@Captain_Burek wrote:

Center positive Is good!

Read full topic

item.title: Power supply - what is too strong and what is just right? mA / V / W
item.dc:creator: @MHScoring Marvin Hartmann
item.description:
@MHScoring wrote:

Thank you very much!!!

In the data sheet I read, that No.2 is centre positiv. Is that the way it should be? Or is centre positive bad?

Read full topic
item.source: Power supply - what is too strong and what is just right? mA / V / W

item.title: Power supply - what is too strong and what is just right? mA / V / W
item.dc:creator: @Captain_Burek Daniel Büring
item.description:
@Captain_Burek wrote:

Voltage-wise you can use anything from 7-15V.

For full USB power, you need about 3.75W, more doesn't hurt.

No 1 will power your axo board, but you might not get the maximum amperage on the USB port, meaning there may be some USB controllers you might not be able to power through the axo. For most, though, it should be fine, as it's just slightly below the recommended 3.75W.

No 2 is more powerful, but i didn't see whether the plug is center positive. This is the one thing to look out for as it could damage your board.

Read full topic
item.source: Power supply - what is too strong and what is just right? mA / V / W

item.description:
@MHScoring wrote:

Hey community,

I am going to build my first synth and since I don't want to fry my board, I need some help regarding the power supply.
My synth is going to be just the board with 10-12 potentiometers plus a contact microphone attached to the input.

My question now is:
Which one of these power adaptors is enough / which one is to strong and would fry the board / which mA amount is perfect?

Nr. 1:

Output voltage: 3.0/4.5/5.0/6.0/7.5/9.0/12 V DC /// Output: 3.6 W /// Current300

reichelt.de

MW 3A03GS - Universal-Schaltnetzteil, 3,6 W, 3 - 12 V, 300 mA

Ausgangsspannung: 3,0 / 4,5 / 5,0 / 6,0 / 7,5 / 9,0 / 12 VDCLeistung: 3,6 WMaße: 69 x 39 x 31 mmDiese neuen, kompakten ECO-friendly Netzteile erfüllen die internationalen Standards nach CEC, MEP [...]

Nr. 2:

output voltage: 9 V DC /// output current: max. 0.66 A /// power: 6 W

reichelt.de

GS06E-2P1J - Single output power supply 9 V, 0.66 A

MeanWell power supply, GS06E seriesoutput voltage: 9 V DCoutput current: max. 0.66 Apower: 6 Wripple&noise: 80 mVppefficiency: 75%Universal AC input / Full rangeNo load power consumption [...]

Please Help me!
Greets
Marvin
